meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny - or, as I like to call it, Hippo Review Time!

I'm diving into the world of Hauntii, a game that's got everyone from The New York Times to Rock, Paper, Shotgun singing its praises. Let's see what all the fuss is about.

First off, I have to give kudos to Moonloop Games for creating a game that's not just visually stunning but also has some serious emotional depth. I mean, who wouldn't want to explore the afterlife with a tiny, faceless Druid-esque being in search of his lost love? It's like a mystical, monochromatic romp through the great beyond!

Now, about those reviews. The New York Times gave Hauntii a 90, praising its artful world and emotional impact. Hardcore Gamer scored it 70, appreciating its clever use of light-and-dark contrast and possession-based mechanics. GAMES.CH came in at 79, loving the puzzles (even if they're a bit too demanding) and slower Twinstick-Shooter action moments.

But what about Multiplayer.it? Well, let's just say their review is still pending... Maybe they were just too busy trying to find those darn puzzles?

As for Rock, Paper, Shotgun? Ah, they gave Hauntii the RPS Bestest Bests seal of approval! That's gotta count for something.

So, what's my take on Hauntii? Well, I'll keep it short: this game is a real treat. It's all about exploring the afterlife, solving puzzles, and having a blast (literally) with that possession-based mechanic. Don't believe me? Try it out for yourself!

P.S. Hippo Penny - I mean, my review - won't be getting any awards anytime soon. But hey, at least I tried!
